questions.question: He said he ___ call me later.
questions.explanation: 'Would' is used to express the future in the past.

questions.question: She was going ___ the report, but she forgot.
questions.explanation: 'Was going to' + base verb is used for planned actions in the past.

questions.question: I thought they ___ arrive earlier.
questions.explanation: Use 'would' to express a future action from a past perspective.

questions.question: We were going ___ a picnic, but it started to rain.
questions.explanation: 'Was/were going to' is used for intentions in the past.

questions.question: I knew you ___ win the match!
She said she ___ help us with the project.
He was going ___ the meeting but missed the train.
questions.explanation: 'Was going to attend' shows a past intention that didn’t happen.

questions.question: They thought it ___ rain that day.
questions.explanation: 'Was going to' expresses prediction in the past.

questions.question: We believed she ___ join the team.
I didn’t know you ___ come!
questions.explanation: 'Were going to' is the correct form for past future plans.

questions.question: He told me he ___ start a new job soon.
They were sure the train ___ on time.
questions.explanation: 'Would arrive' is used for the future in the past.

questions.question: We thought the weather ___ better.
questions.explanation: 'Would be' is the past form of 'will be'.

questions.question: She was going ___ her presentation before lunch.
questions.explanation: 'Was going to give' shows her intention in the past.

questions.question: I knew it ___ be easy.
questions.explanation: Negative form of 'would' is used for past future.
